stem: The nurse is caring for a patient with acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Based on the information provided, identify the interventions that are indicated or contraindicated for this patient.

rationale.correct:
Administering oxygen to achieve a target SpO2 of 88-92% will improve oxygenation without suppressing the respiratory drive.
Administering bronchodilators via nebulizer will help to open the airways and improve airflow.
Encouraging pursed-lip breathing will help to prolong exhalation and prevent airway collapse.
Administering antibiotics as prescribed will treat the underlying infection contributing to the exacerbation.

mnemonic.COPD Management: Oxygen, Bronchodilators, Corticosteroids, Antibiotics, Pulmonary Hygiene

rationale.incorrect:
Administering a sedative will further suppress the respiratory drive in a patient with elevated PaCO2. 
Initiating continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) without a provider order is inappropriate and potentially harmful. The patient needs assessment first.
Withholding fluids will thicken secretions, making them more difficult to expectorate.

questionTrap.CPAP: CPAP is an appropriate intervention in some COPD exacerbations but needs a provider order first after the patient has been assessed.
questionTrap.Sedatives: Sedatives may seem helpful to calm the patient, but they suppress the respiratory drive and increase PaCO2.

clinicalPearls: In COPD patients, avoid high FiO2 as it can suppress their respiratory drive.
Pursed-lip breathing helps to slow the respiratory rate and improve ventilation.
Monitor ABGs closely to assess the effectiveness of interventions.

itemContext.sbar: Patient admitted with increased shortness of breath, productive cough with thick yellow sputum, and wheezing. Oxygen saturation 88% on room air. Patient reports increased use of albuterol inhaler at home with minimal relief.

responseOptions.text: Administer oxygen to achieve a target SpO2 of 88-92%
Administer a sedative to reduce anxiety
Withhold fluids to reduce sputum production
